text: Is there anything sadder than a smart premise gone to waste through misguided execution, like the one director Alexander Payne squanders in the dreary satire “ Downsizing ”? Payne has a lot of targets in his sights, including consumerism, do - gooding scientists and the obliviousness of well - to - do people to see beyond their own navels. And the premise he and co - writer Jim Taylor devise seems like a perfect projectile to hit those targets : a near future where scientists have devised a way to shrink human bodies to 5 inches tall, a development the scientists say can solve the world ’ s ills of overpopulation and diminishing resources.
